title: Artist Profile: Dominic Watson
content:
Dominic Watson sings, chants at, and dances with prominent pieces of public sculpture, but the snooty, stone faced fools don’t even react.

I think its impossible for even a piece of stone to leave this hilariously infectious artist cold and alone on the dance floor.

Watching Dominic’s attempts at getting Henry Moore’s womanly looking figures standing solitarily in the Galloway Hills, to join in with his effortlessly charming rendition of Queen’s Fat Bottomed Girls, these now humanised pieces of rock stare back at the artist snobbishly and you’re left copiously giggling at the screen with frustration impatiently waiting for a response that never arrives, not even a snigger.
High Art. Loosen up and have a laugh.
